title: Love or covert mission? Spy mystery deepens as Nagpur woman's chats with Pakistani contacts surface
content: Sunita, a 43-year-old woman from Nagpur, faces espionage charges after being handed over by Pakistani authorities. She crossed the LoC to meet Pakistani contacts, raising suspicions of spying due to heightened tensions. Authorities are scrutinizing her communications, investigating whether her actions were driven by personal relationships or a larger espionage plot, while her son is being escorted back to Nagpur.

title: ITR filing AY 2025-26: Deadline to file returns extended - check new date
content: Good news for taxpayers. The Central Board of Direct Taxes has provided an extension for filing Income Tax Returns. The new deadline is September 15, 2025. This applies to returns originally due by July 31, 2025. The extension accommodates revisions in ITR forms. It also considers ongoing system development.

title: IMD predicts ‘above normal’ monsoon with 106% rainfall
content: India is projected to experience above-normal rainfall during the monsoon season from June to September, with 106% of the long period average. Central and peninsular India are expected to receive higher-than-usual rainfall, benefiting agriculture in the monsoon core zone. While northwest India anticipates normal rainfall, northeast India may experience below-normal rainfall.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in America without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: Tej Pratap breaks silence after family ouster, congratulates Tejashwi on newborn son
content: Tej Pratap Yadav congratulated his brother Tejashwi on the birth of his second child, a son, after being expelled from the RJD by his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav, for revealing a long-term relationship and citing moral values. Tejashwi supported his father's decision, emphasizing personal freedom while upholding the party's dedication to the people of Bihar.

title: Liverpool car-ramming attack: Why such incidents are hard to prevent
content: Yet the incident adds to a growing list of ramming attacks that have plagued cities across the globe—from Vancouver to Munich, Magdeburg to New Orleans and Zhuhai. In just the past six months, such attacks have killed 71 people, according to the National Transportation Security Center.

title: Fan goes wild imitating cheerleaders during IPL match, police steps in
content: During an IPL 2025 match between CSK and RR, a fan's spirited imitation of cheerleaders led to a brief interruption by security. On the field, Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive 57 guided Rajasthan to a six-wicket victory, chasing down 188 with ease. Despite the win and notable performances from both sides, both teams failed to qualify for the knockouts.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' college students: World you're entering ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: Tahawwur Rana moves court for permission to communicate with his family
content: Tahawwur Rana, a key conspirator in the 2008 Mumbai attacks, has petitioned a Delhi court for family communication access while in judicial custody following his extradition from the US. The Ministry of Home Affairs has appointed a team of special public prosecutors, led by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, to oversee the NIA case against him.

title: May-Hem in Mumbai: How earliest ever monsoon arrival cought authorities off guard
content: Mumbai experienced its earliest monsoon onset ever recorded, breaking a century-old rainfall record for May with 295mm. The city received very heavy rainfall, with Colaba recording 144.3 mm and Santacruz 74.3 mm. The intense showers exposed the city's unpreparedness, leading to waterlogging in new areas, disruption of train and flight services, and incidents of structural damage.

title: Nasa warns! 25-storey building sized asteroid set to pass close to Earth on May 28
content: Asteroid 2025 JR, about the size of a 25-story building, is set to pass Earth on May 28 at a distance of 4.6 million kilometers. Though not considered a hazardous asteroid, its size and speed highlight the potential devastation of an impact. Scientists worldwide are tracking NEOs like 2025 JR to improve planetary defense.

title: Billionaire Mark Cuban on why he does not drive Tesla: You've got to find ...
content: Mark Cuban prefers his Kia EV6 over his Tesla, citing user-friendliness, particularly the traditional turn signal design. Despite his preference, Cuban's teenage son isn't impressed, labeling the Kia a "nerd car." Cuban, a known critic of Elon Musk, has also playfully admitted to provoking Musk due to his perceived sensitivity.

title: CBSE re-evaluation: Application window to obtain scanned answer sheets opens
content: The CBSE has commenced the application process for students seeking scanned copies of their 2025 board exam answer sheets. This initiative allows Class 10 and 12 students to review their evaluated papers, apply for marks verification, and request re-evaluation if needed.

title: 'Your visa may be revoked if ...': US embassy warns Indian, international students
content: The U.S. government has cautioned international students that their visas could be revoked for non-compliance, such as skipping classes or dropping out without notifying their institutions. This action could also jeopardize their future eligibility for U.S. visas. This warning follows reports of over 4,700 international students having their study permissions revoked this spring, potentially due to stricter immigration enforcement.

title: Tom Brady ditches NFL life for Italian women, big money & Raiders control
content: Tom Brady is thriving post-divorce, making waves from Venice to Las Vegas. He's transitioned from NFL icon to media mogul with a record-breaking Fox Sports contract and an active role as a minority owner of the Raiders, influencing team decisions. Brady is embracing personal freedom and enjoying a new chapter filled with power and leisure.

title: Limping Rishabh Pant walks over to gift a fan something special
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru aim for a top-two IPL 2025 finish against Lucknow Super Giants, who seek a positive end to their campaign. RCB's path was cleared by Gujarat Titans' defeats, offering a Qualifier 1 spot. However, a post-break loss and washed-out match have disrupted RCB's momentum after a strong winning streak.

title: Rolex, Thar, plots: Dismissed cop Amandeep Kaur's lavish life under scanner
content: Amandeep Kaur, a Punjab Police head constable known as 'Instagram Queen,' was arrested for possessing assets disproportionate to her income. Authorities froze her properties worth ₹1.35 crore, including a house, plot, Thar, and luxury items. Previously dismissed for a heroin possession, she violated social media rules by posting reels in uniform.

title: Akshay Kumar breaks silence on Paresh Rawal leaving 'Hera Pheri 3'
content: Following Paresh Rawal's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3' and the subsequent lawsuit filed by Akshay Kumar's production house, Akshay addressed the issue at a 'Housefull 5' trailer launch. He defended Rawal against negative comments, emphasizing their long-standing friendship and professional respect. Kumar acknowledged the seriousness of the legal matter, stating it would be handled by the courts.

title: Bold statement! 'Shreyas Iyer felt underappreciated at KKR'
content: Under Shreyas Iyer's leadership, Punjab Kings have secured a Qualifier 1 spot in the 2025 IPL season, showcasing a remarkable turnaround. Iyer's captaincy has instilled stability and direction, earning praise from experts like Robin Uthappa. His inclusive leadership style, as highlighted by teammate Shashank Singh, has fostered a positive team environment, fueling their historic campaign.

title: Tyreek Hill trade rumors intensify as Dolphins weigh 2025 contract gamble
content: Tyreek Hill's future with the Miami Dolphins is uncertain as guaranteed money in his contract expires after 2025. Following a less productive 2024 season and public expressions of frustration, the Dolphins must decide whether to extend his contract, trade him for assets, or play out the 2025 season and reassess.

title: 'No one helped us': Family of 7 suicide in Panchkula leaves neighbourhood in shock
content: In a tragic incident in Panchkula, Praveen Mittal and his family of six were found dead in their car, victims of suspected suicide due to overwhelming financial debts. Praveen, visibly distraught, confessed to their dire situation before collapsing, leaving the community in shock.

title: 'Haven't done anything yet and Pakistan is already sweating': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning to Pakistan, highlighting India's actions regarding the Indus Water Treaty and its impact. He criticized the neglect of dam maintenance in Jammu and Kashmir under the treaty, asserting India's right to utilize its water resources effectively. Modi emphasized a firm stance against terrorism, advocating a strong response to cross-border attacks.

title: 'Trump app scam': Over 200 in Karnataka fall prey to investment fraud
content: A fraudulent app named 'Trump Hotel Rental,' featuring AI-generated content of the former US President, has reportedly defrauded over 200 investors in Karnataka of nearly Rs 2 crore. The scammers lured victims with promises of high returns on investments, but the earnings displayed on the app were fictitious. Police investigations are underway across multiple districts following numerous complaints.

title: BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points: Top reasons markets are falling today
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 24,750 intraday, BSE Sensex tanked over 1,000 points.

title: Instamart sheds Swiggy branding in bid for standalone identity
content: Instamart, a quick commerce platform, is distancing itself from the Swiggy branding to establish its own independent identity, following a similar move by Zomato. This strategic shift reflects Instamart's growth beyond groceries and food delivery, aiming to become a standalone brand with its own loyal user base. The new logo incorporates Swiggy's 'S-Pin' as a nod to its origins.

title: Explosion rocks chemical plant in China; over 230 firefighters deployed
content: A significant explosion struck Gaomi Youdao Chemical Co. in Weifang, Shandong province, China, on Tuesday, prompting a large-scale emergency response. The blast, which occurred around noon local time, released dark smoke visible from the facility, a producer of pesticides and medical chemicals.

title: Video | 'Housefull 5' trailer out: Film promises laugh riot with suspense
content: The 'Housefull 5' trailer unveils a murder mystery aboard a cruise liner, where Akshay, Abhishek, and Riteish vie for an inheritance. After a night of revelry, they're accused of murder, prompting investigators Sanjay Dutt and Jackie Shroff to unravel the truth.

title: Watch: Nasa astronaut captures Northern Lights aurora over North America
content: Astronaut Nichole Ayers, aboard the International Space Station, captured a stunning display of the Northern Lights over North America. While photographing severe storms, Ayers unexpectedly witnessed the vibrant green and purple aurora, triggered by heightened geomagnetic activity. The NOAA reported a Kp index of 6, enhancing visibility from space and Earth.

title: BCCI to honour Indian Armed forces during IPL 2025 closing ceremony
content: The BCCI will dedicate the IPL 2025 closing ceremony to India's armed forces, honouring their valour during Operation Sindoor. Senior armed forces officials have been invited, and stands will be dedicated to them during the match. The ceremony will feature patriotic songs and a possible performance by military bands, creating a solemn tribute to the nation's heroes.

title: 'Turned into criminal': HC raps Maha govt for arresting student over Op Sindoor post
content: The Bombay high court rebuked the Maharashtra government for its extreme response in arresting a 19-year-old student over a social media post about Operation Sindoor. The court questioned why the student was treated as a criminal after she apologized, emphasizing the importance of reform over punishment.

title: It's not over yet! IMD warns of rain, storms in Delhi on May 30 & 31
content: Delhi is bracing for a wet and stormy end to May, with the India Meteorological Department forecasting rain, thunderstorms, and gusty winds up to 60 kmph. These conditions are expected to keep temperatures below normal, contrasting sharply with last year's heatwave. Delhi has experienced its wettest May ever, with 186.

title: 'Influenced contracts in BMC': What EOW said after questioning Dino Morea river scam
content: Actor Dino Morea and his brother Santino were questioned by the Economic Offences Wing for eight hours regarding the Mithi river desilting scam. Santino's company shares an address with Vodar India LLP, a company under investigation. Authorities are investigating potential connections between Dino Morea, Ketan Kadam (an arrested suspect), and possible influence on BMC contracts.

title: Sub-7 day fixed deposits soon? Here’s what RBI has asked banks to consider
content: The Reserve Bank of India is exploring the possibility of allowing banks to offer fixed deposits with tenures shorter than seven days, seeking feedback from banks by the end of the month. This move aims to boost deposit attractiveness and liquidity amid declining deposit growth.

title: Karnataka BJP expels MLAs Somashekar, Hebbar for 6 years over 'anti-party' activities
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has expelled two of its Karnataka MLAs, S T Somashekar and A Shivaram Hebbar, for six years due to alleged anti-party activities. State president B Y Vijayendra announced the decision after deliberations by the BJP high command. The expulsion letters cite repeated violations of party discipline and immediate removal from primary membership and party positions.

title: Woman trespasses into Aditya Roy Kapur's home in Mumbai, complaint filed against her
content: A woman trespassed into Aditya Roy Kapur's Mumbai residence while he was away filming. Identifying herself as Gazala Jhakaria Siddique from Dubai, she claimed to have brought gifts for the actor. Kapur, upon returning, didn't recognize her and alerted his manager, who then contacted the police.

title: Can Kuldeep Yadav be India's trump card in England?
content: The last time England's "Bazballers" faced Kuldeep Yadav, they found it tough to pick his length, variations, and to some extent, loop as well. He took 19 wickets in four Test matches on a "true wicket," not a rank-turner, and turned the tide towards India after they were trailing 0-1 in the five-match series. Although Kuldeep won't have fond memories of England, where he had a forgettable experience at Lord's in 2018, at 30, with more maturity and improved skillsets, he can be India's trump card.

title: Blast in Amritsar village near Pak border kills suspected Babbar Khalsa member
content: A man died in an explosion near Naushera village in Amritsar, close to the Pakistan border. Police suspect the blast was caused by mishandling an explosive device. The deceased is believed to be a member of Babbar Khalsa, a banned terror group with suspected ties to Pakistan’s ISI, who came to retrieve an explosive consignment.

title: 'We haven't achieved anything': Ponting says PBKS can’t celebrate yet
content: Despite Punjab Kings securing a top-two IPL 2025 playoff spot with a victory over Mumbai Indians, coach Ricky Ponting emphasises that the team's journey is far from over. He acknowledges the team's balance and leadership under Shreyas Iyer, but stresses the importance of maintaining focus and finishing the job in the upcoming Qualifier 1.

title: India’s first! Tata-Airbus to make 'best-selling' H125 chopper in India
content: Airbus and Tata Advanced Systems will establish an H125 helicopter Final Assembly Line in Kolar, Karnataka, marking India's first private-sector helicopter assembly. The facility aims to produce 10 helicopters annually, expanding based on a projected regional demand of 500 light helicopters over two decades.

title: Virender Sehwag takes a cheeky jibe at Rohit Sharma
content: Virender Sehwag playfully commented on Rohit Sharma's struggles in the IPL powerplay, noting that a slower start might help him stay at the crease longer, given his tendency to get out early. Rohit's recent form includes only three scores above 50 in 13 innings, with nine dismissals during the powerplay.

title: Kerala has most number of active Covid cases in India
content: Kerala is currently experiencing a surge in Covid-19 cases, reporting the highest number of active cases in the country with 430, a significant jump from 95 earlier in May. While most patients experience mild symptoms like fatigue and cough and recover without hospitalization, two deaths have been recorded this month. The elderly and those with comorbidities remain particularly vulnerable.

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder take win over Wolves in a tough Game 4
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Jalen Williams' breakout playoff effort fuels OKC
content: Oklahoma City's Jalen Williams had the best offensive performance of his postseason career Monday night against the Timberwolves, scoring 34 points to put the Thunder one win away from the NBA Finals.

title: 'That's wonderful': Canes finally see ECF skid end
content: The Hurricanes staved off elimination and snapped a 15-game Eastern Conference finals skid with a 3-0 victory over the Panthers in Game 4.

title: Ant defends Game 4 approach after quiet night
content: After one of his quietest offensive nights this postseason, Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards defended his approach in Monday's Game 4 loss to the Thunder that put Minnesota on the brink of playoff elimination.

title: Uzan withdrawing from draft to return to Houston
content: Houston guard Milos Uzan will withdraw his name from the 2025 NBA draft, agent Aman Dhesi told ESPN's Jonathan Givony.

title: Police say Liverpool parade collision not terrorism
content: The Merseyside Police have said that the incident of a car colliding with pedestrians in Liverpool city center during Liverpool Football Club's Premier League victory parade is not being treated as terrorism.

title: Dodgers' Ohtani hits 2nd leadoff homer in 2 days
content: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani, the reigning NL MVP, hit a leadoff homer in consecutive games for the second time in his career, going deep against Cleveland's Gavin Williams for his 19th long ball of the season in his club's 7-2 win Monday.

title: Sources: Raiders' Cole now NFL's top-paid punter
content: The Raiders and All-Pro punter AJ Cole have agreed to a four-year, $15.8 million contract extension with $11 million guaranteed, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ronaldo hints at Al Nassr exit: 'Chapter is over'
content: Cristiano Ronaldo hinted at a potential departure from Al Nassr after scoring in the Saudi Pro League's season finale Monday, declaring his "chapter is over" in a social media post.

title: 🏈 Ranking college football coaches as players
content: There are small-school studs and a Heisman winner. There's a national title QB and one of the best ever.

title: Solak's 100 things to know for the 2025 NFL season ... 100 days out
content: There are 100 days until the 2025 NFL season kicks off. Let's celebrate with 100 big thoughts, predictions, stats and situations to watch.

title: A hidden stat is deciding the NBA's conference finals
content: The most important plays of Knicks-Pacers and Thunder-Timberwolves are happening nowhere near the basket.

title: Can anyone unseat Judge and Ohtani? Latest on all of MLB's award races
content: With Memorial Day weekend behind us, it's time to take our first look at the leaders for MVP, Cy Young and more.

title: Memorial Day standings check: Playoff predictions, biggest surprises, more
content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: Indiana's losses drop the Fever while Seattle's three-win streak bumps up the Storm in our latest 1-13 ranking.

title: Caitlin Clark injury reaction: What's next for Indiana Fever star
content: The Fever announced Clark will miss at least two weeks with a quad strain. What's next for Clark and her team?

title: NBA free agent rankings: Kevin Pelton's top 25 for 2025
content: Will LeBron James opt in or sign a new deal? Can Indy keep Myles Turner? We're breaking down what's next for 25 star free agents.

title: The decline of a dynasty: The Patriots had a 'difficult' two seasons. Can Mike Vrabel reignite them?﻿
content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Summer transfers each top Premier League club should make
content: All of the big Premier League clubs need to make big moves in this summer transfer window -- even the good ones. Here's what they should do.

title: LaLiga awards: The Year of Yamal as Barça dominate
content: With the sun set on LaLiga for 2024-25, ESPN hands out silverware for the best and worst of the season. No prizes for guessing who hogs the headlines.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League season grades for: How well did the 20 teams do?
content: Which teams passed and which failed to make the grade during the 2024-25 season? Ian Darke has the answers.

title: It's Good Guy vs. Bad Guy on Season 33 of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen break down what to expect from this season of TUF.

title: Goodbye Manchester, hello trophies: Nine ex-United stars who won elsewhere in 2024-25
content: Scott McTominay won an MVP prize in Italy, Dean Henderson won the FA Cup with Crystal Palace, and either Jadon Sancho or Antony will win the UEFA Europa Conference League crown this week. Who else cast out by United has thrived this season?

title: Mary Earps retires from England duty before Euros
content: England goalkeeper Mary Earps has announced her shock decision to retire from international football, just six weeks before the start of Euro 2025.

title: Sources: Man Utd wait on Delap after deal agreed
content: Man United have agreed the framework of a deal for Liam Delap, sources have told ESPN, and are now waiting for him to decide on his next move.

title: Amorim: Missing UCL could benefit Man United
content: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has said not playing in the Champions League next season could benefit the team.

title: Sources: Yamal nears new Barça deal until 2031
content: Lamine Yamal is close to extending his Barcelona contract until 2031 after a positive meeting between club president Joan Laporta and the player's agent, Jorge Mendes, on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Zaniolo denies punching two Roma youth players
content: Fiorentina midfielder Nicolò Zaniolo has denied allegations that he punched two Roma youth players after Monday's Primavera Championship semifinal in Florence.

title: Two iconic races, one day: McLaren's quest to win Monaco, Indy 500
content: On Sunday, McLaren tried to win two races 4,500 miles apart: F1's Monaco GP and IndyCar's Indianapolis 500.

title: Waiver wire: Three hitters to add power to your infield
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your fantasy roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Gakpo on Bayern shortlist
content: Bayern Munich have added Liverpool forward Cody Gakpo to their shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Scatter my ashes in Ganga, fields': Congress shares excerpts from Nehru's will
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: BSNL posts Rs 280 crore Q4 profit, second straight quarter in green after 18 years
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce and can navigate the complexities of the business world .

title: ‘Not intimidated by cowardly acts’: Omar holds cabinet meet in Pahalgam, thanks returning tourists
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Indian-Americans in several leadership roles across Harvard University
content: I’ve been a journalist with The Economic Times for 25+ years; first at the newsdesk of ET, Kolkata & then as a feature writer with the ET Magazine on Sunday in Delhi. I write largely on immigration policy issues and overseas Indians. I also write on entrepreneurs in food & beverages; crafts and education sectors. I’m a Jefferson Fellow 2019 of the East-West Center, Hawaii. title: Final 2025 recruiting class rankings: 4 new teams, plus risers and fallers
content: the 2025 men's basketball recruiting class was missing star power in march . the last update in January saw multiple five-star prospects make commitments . a.J. Dybantsa and niko Bundalo traded buckets in the second quarter .

title: Delhi Chief Minister Hands Over Job Letters To Family Of 1984 Riot Victims
content: In a significant move aimed at delivering long-overdue justice, Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, along with Cabinet Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa, on Tuesday distributed government job letters to family members of the 1984 anti-Sikh riot victims.

title: Man Makes Hoax Bomb Threat To Mumbai Airport, Arrested Within An Hour
content: Mumbai Police on Tuesday apprehended a man from the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC) area in connection with a bomb threat to the Mumbai airport, officials said.

title: Man Killed In Sword Attack In Mangaluru, Second In A Month
content: Two men were brutally attacked with a sword in Karnataka on Tuesday, while one of them died at a hospital during treatment, the other is fighting for his life, said the police.

title: Climate Scientists Aren't Trusted As Much As Other Scientists, Reveals Study
content: Do people trust climate scientists, and what affects levels of trust? Our new study shows climate scientists are less trusted than other types of scientists globally. But there are profound variations in this trust gap between countries.

title: Income Tax Returns Filing Deadline Extended From July 31 To September 15
content: The Income Tax department on Tuesday extended the due date for filing ITRs for Assessment Year (AY) 2025-26 to September 15 from July 31.

title: Above-Normal June Rainfall To Keep Heat In Check In India: Weather Body
content: India is likely to receive above-normal rainfall in June, which is expected to keep maximum temperatures in check in most parts of the country, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Tuesday.

title: 'Insta Queen' Ex Cop With Rolex, Thar, Plots Worth Over Rs 1 Crore Arrested
content: Mahindra Thar, Royal Enfield Bullet motorcycle, plots worth over a crore, two iPhones and a Rolex watch - these high-end assets belong to a dismissed police constable in Punjab.

title: Local Weather Conditions Can Impact Prevalence Of Tuberculosis: Study
content: Researchers who mapped tuberculosis cases in African countries found that local weather conditions and access to cities can influence prevalence of the bacterial disease.

title: Family Seeks Suicide Note, Rejects Financial Debt Theory In Panchkula Tragedy
content: With Panchkula shocked as seven members of a family were found dead in a car and police suspect a mass suicide allegedly due to financial stress, the family members are demanding transparency from authorities, especially the release of a suicide note

title: "Crime Is Bad": The Fall Of Russian Ransomware Giant LockBit
content: The sudden fall of a ransomware supplier once described as the world's most harmful cybercrime group has raised questions about Moscow's role in its development and the fate of its founder.

title: Odisha To Patent Words Linked To Jagannath Temple Amid Fight With Bengal
content: Odisha is engaged in an ongoing dispute with West Bengal over the naming of a new temple as "Jagannath Dham".

title: Delhi Police Issues Orders Against Personnel Making Videos In Uniform
content: Terming the act of making reels in khaki an "abuse of uniform", Delhi Police Commissioner Sanjay Arora has cautioned personnel from doing so, directing them to distinguish between their "personal and professional lives".

title: "If India Maintains 6 Per Cent Growth...": NITI Aayog Member Predicts Outcome
content: India is all set to become the third largest economy in the world by 2027-28, Dr Arvind Virmani, member of government think tank NITI Aayog has told NDTV in an exclusive interview.

title: Sensex Falls 625 Points, Stock Market Ends Lower On Profit Booking
content: The Indian stock market closed in the red on Tuesday due to profit booking, driven by valuation concerns and weakness across the Asian markets.

title: India Approves Stealth Fighter Jet Plan Amid China's Offer To Pakistan
content: Amid reports of China fast-tracking its plan to deliver stealth fighter jets to Pakistan to bolster its arsenal to counter India's air superiority over its western neighbour, New Delhi has also approved a framework to make its own stealth aircraft.

title: Bombay High Court Raps Maharashtra For Teen's Arrest Over Op Sindoor Post
content: Pulling up the Maharashtra government for arresting a 19-year-old college student in Pune for a social media post on the India-Pakistan conflict, the Bombay High Court has said the State has turned the teenage girl "into a criminal"

title: How Asif Ali Zardari Managed To Get Pervez Musharraf To Resign As Pak President
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari managed his first term by skilfully getting then incumbent Pervez Musharraf to resign in August 2008 by securing the backing of his successor as Army chief, and then, outmanoeuvring coalition ally Nawaz Sharif.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Plea To Include Sarvarkar's Name In Emblems Act
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed a plea seeking directions that the name of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar is not misused and his name be included in the Emblems and Names (Prevention of Improper Use) Act.

title: 6 Of Family Die Inside Car, 7th Sitting Outside Said "Will Die In 5 Mins"
content: The dead have been identified as Praveen Mittal, 42, his elderly parents, wife and three young children - two girls and a boy.

title: Rs 20 Crore Debt Reportedly Behind Suicide Pact Of Family Of 7
content: A family of seven, including three children, allegedly consumed poison and died by suicide owing to financial distress.

title: How Carolina stayed alive and what's ahead for Game 5 against Florida
content: the Carolina Hurricanes beat the canes 3-0 in the Eastern Conference finals . the Panthers centered on how they would perform knowing they were a loss away from their season ending . there's at least one more contest to look forward to next week's game .

title: ESPN Junior 300: Comparisons for top 2027 prospects
content: a quarterback commit reminds us of one of the top quarterback prospects in the country, as well as yet another elite Ohio State wide receiver commit . the top players at each position stack up, with a focus on five-stars who could continue to impress in the months ahead .

title: Mourinho expects to be at Fenerbahce next season
content: Jose Mourinho says he expects to remain at the club next season . the portuguese coach joined the club on a two-year contract last summer . he was speaking after his side's 4-2 league loss at Hatayspor on monday .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: How Ryan Nugent-Hopkins has been the Oilers' 'Swiss Army knife'
content: a team's captain, arguably the NHL's best player, can hand out a statement . "he's our Swiss Army knife," Connor McDavid says of nugent-Hopkins after the Oilers' 6-1 drubbing of the Dallas Stars in the Western Conference finals on Sunday . the statement was reverberating among those following the oilers' playoff run .

title: Stars-Oilers Game 4 preview: Can Dallas punch back to even it up?
content: Connor McDavid and Zach Hyman each net two goals to power the Oilers to a 2-1 series lead vs. the Stars . the good news for the Dallas Stars is that they need to get to Game 7 for that matter . can they punch back in Game 4 to knot the matchup at 2-2 heading back home to Dallas for Game 5?

title: Dharwad gets three mobile clinics for workers and their families
content: Labour minister and district-in-charge for Dharwad Santosh Lad has said that with the objective of extending healthcare benefits to the workers and their family members, health check up was being conducted through mobile clinics at construction sites and work places.

title: Rotary Club sponsors 19 gas-based crematoriums in state; Vizianagaram unit inaugurated
content: The Vizianagaram club has set up water plants, organised plantation drives, and distributed tricycles to physically challenged individuals

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Case against actor Unni Mukundan for alleged assault on his manager
content: Vipin Kumar complains that the actor assaulted him in the basement parking of an apartment complex in Kakkanad

title: Lokesh moves six resolutions at Mahanadu to serve as  beacon for future
content: Efforts to earn more global recognition for ‘Telugu identity’, empowerment of youth and women among them

title: Second chargesheet submitted in Venjaramoodu multiple murders
content: The chargesheet pertains to the murder case of Affan’s uncle Abdul Latheef and aunt Shahida. A few days ago, the first chargesheet was filed in the murder of his grandmother

title: Madras High Court restrains media from reporting Tamil actor’s matrimonial dispute
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan says, the right to privacy of the couple’s children must be respected by the media

title: Pawar family and Thackeray family should reunite, says Maharashtra Cabinet Minister
content: I have seen him since very young days. He was groomed under the tutelage of Sharad Pawar. Who likes to see them apart? says Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chhagan Bhujbal

title: Tourism should be treated as a conflict-neutral activity: Omar Abdullah after Pahalgam Cabinet meet
content: My government will ensure that the tourism sector is insulated from the situation J&K faces. All should see tourism as an economic activity more than anything else, says J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

title: Monsoons: Nandyal and Kurnool on alert
content: Officials directed to take precautionary measures to prevent possible spread of seasonal diseases during the rains

title: Tracking Kerala’s monsoon: updates, warnings and impact
content: A discussion to assess Kerala’s disaster management system and what early onset of monsoon means for the State.

title: Chhagan Bhujbal slams Banthia panel report on OBCs
content: In exclusive interview, when asked if Maharashtra will withdraw report from apex court, he says it won’t matter as Indira Sawhney order will stand supreme

title: Manonmaniam Sundaranar University in Tirunelveli cancels exam after question paper leak
content: The sixth-semester Industrial Law question paper, meant for B. Com third-year students, was printed and shared with the principals of the affiliated colleges a week ago

title: Low pressure area forms over Bay of Bengal off Odisha
content: The system is likely to move slowly northwards and become more marked during the next 48 hours. Heavy to very heavy rain is likely to occur at isolated places over Western Ghats areas of Coimbatore and the Nilgiris districts on May 28.

title: Kerala rains: Orange alert for Meenachil, Korappuzha, Achankovil, Manimala rivers as water level rises
content: Kerala Irrigation dept advises people living on banks of these rivers to be cautious against rising water levels

title: Indian delegation engages in diplomatic outreach across Muslim world
content: Representing the Indian Government in a delegation to the Muslim world, Asaduddin Owaisi affirmed its stance against terrorism, citing the Quran’s message that killing one innocent person, not just a Muslim, is like killing all of humanity

title: T.N. CM Stalin dismisses Palaniswami’s remarks on his New Delhi visit
content: During a brief interaction with journalists in Chennai, Mr. Stalin, when asked about Mr. Palaniswami’s remarks over his visit to the national capital to attend the NITI Aayog meeting, said: “He has nothing else to criticise this government for, so he keeps repeating this.”

title: BMRCL rolls back public toilet fee at 12 Namma Metro stations after protests in Bengaluru
content: BMRCL had handed over management of restrooms located in the unpaid areas (outside the ticketed zone) of select metro stations to Sulabh International

title: Opposition MPs representing India abroad better than government, claims Congress
content: Party leaders allege that the government has failed on both foreign policy and narrative management; raise questions on India’s diplomatic standing post-Pahalgam attack

title: Tejashwi Yadav, wife Rajshree announce birth of second child
content: The baby was born in a private hospital in Kolkata where Rajshree was admitted for the last few days.

title: 2015 custodial death case: T.N. SHRC recommends ₹10 lakh compensation to deceased’s family
content: The Commission had taken suo motu cognisance of a report published in The Hindu over the custodial death of Gokulakannan and the protests that followed

title: ‘Atmosphere of fear reduced in Kashmir’: Farooq Abdullah plays golf in Pahalgam with friends
content: Farooq Abdullah urges tourists to visit Kashmir, highlighting reduced fear and natural beauty, while calling for travel advisories to be lifted

title: Jharkhand Class 10 result 2025: Girls outperform boys, Koderma district topped
content: The pass percentage of the state board's examinations in Jharkhand increased this year by 1.31 per cent compared to the previous year.

title: Bombay High Court rebukes Maharashtra Govt. for college student's arrest for post on India-Pakistan conflict
content: On May 7, 2025, the girl reposted a post on Instagram from an account called 'Reformistan', which criticised the Indian government for provoking a war against Pakistan

title: Coastal Karnataka records highest ‘large excess’ cumulative rainfall in about three months
content: Manchi Gram Panchayat in Bantwal taluk of Dakshina Kannada recorded 186.5 mm rainfall in 24 hours ending at 8.30 a.m. on May 27, which is the second highest rainfall recorded in Karnataka

title: TVK chief Vijay condemns ‘police attack’ on party women functionaries in Vyasarpadi
content: He alleged that the police obstructed and attacked women functionaries of his party at Vyasarpadi, when they were distributing aid to people affected by a fire in the area

title: Suspected Khalistani terrorist killed in blast in Amritsar
content: The man was retrieving explosive material from a vacant area; the DIG said the man was yet to be identified

title: Shrikanth Mangalwedhe, former Belagavi correpondent of The Hindu, passes away
content: As a staff correspondent, he reported widely about the language agitation and other prominent developments from Belagavi district.

title: Terrorism is Pakistan’s war strategy, India to respond accordingly: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that whenever India and Pakistan went to war, Indian armed forces defeated Pakistan in a way the neighbouring country would never forget

title: P.V. Anvar’s dissent won’t affect UDF in Nilambur bypoll, says K. Sudhakaran
content: Sudhakaran says though Anvar is upset over nomination of Aryadan Shoukath, it will not jeopardise his relationship with UDF

title: BJP expels two rebel MLAs from Karnataka for six years over ‘anti-party activities’
content: Somashekar and Hebbar, who represent Yeshwanthpur and Yellapur Assembly constituencies respectively, had joined the BJP from Congress through operation Kamala in 2019.

title: Bangalore Palace grounds case: Supreme Court refers Karnataka’s plea to CJI to consider setting up a larger Bench
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Dipankar Datta referred the case to the Chief Justice to consider, on the administrative side, whether the application must be heard by a larger Bench of three judges.

title: Trees, roofing sheet fall onto railway track in Kerala’s Kozhikode; major mishap averted
content: Heavy winds lead to uprooting of trees that fell onto railway track at Areekkad in Kozhikode twice within 24 hours

title: With sports becoming a profession, youngsters should look for opportunities in the field, says former international cricketer Javagal Srinath
content: While sportspersons in India were only practising on the field, besides lifting weights in the gym, their counterparts in other countries were undergoing advanced and in-depth training programmes, he said

title: Owaisi mocks Pakistan’s Munir for gifting ‘fake photo’ to PM Sharif
content: Asaduddin Owaisi is part of the multi-party delegation visiting Kuwait to brief nations on India’s response to the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Karnataka rains: Early and more intense monsoon disrupts life in coastal and south interior parts of Stata
content: Four rain-related deaths were reported in various part of Karnataka between from Sunday night till Monday evening

title: What is the Bharat Forecast System: world’s highest resolution forecasting model
content: India’s new high-resolution BFS model delivers 6-km precision forecasts at the panchayat level, surpassing US, UK, and EU systems in accuracy. What is BFS?

title: Bodies of five youths drowned in river Godavari in Konaseema  retrieved
content: The eight youths, including two minors, reportedly ventured into the river as they were not familiar with its location and depth; Rescue operations by the NDRF are still in progress.

title: AUT wants unified admission panel for self-financing and aided streams in colleges in T.N.
content: Association of University Teachers calls for fee regulations, CAS payment, and administrative reforms in aided colleges

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh approves AMCA execution model through industry partnership
content: The first prototype of AMCA is expected to roll out by 2028-29 and production is expected to begin from 2032-33 with induction targeted in 2034, as per officials

title: In Iran, Pakistan PM expresses willingness to hold peace talks with India to ‘resolve all issues’
content: "We want to resolve all disputes, including the Kashmir issue and the water issue, through negotiations and are also ready to talk to our neighbour on trade and counter-terrorism,” he said.

title: PM Modi holds roadshow in Gandhinagar
content: People gathered in large numbers, waving the tricolour along the route of PM Modi’s roadshow in Gandhinagar.

title: IMD issues red alert for three Kerala districts as low-pressure system strengthens monsoon winds
content: Red alert for three districts – Kannur, Wayanad and Kozhikode – and orange alert for remaining districts except Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam and Alappuzha where yellow alert has been sounded

title: Odisha to patent terminologies associated with Puri Jagannath temple
content: The move to patent temple-related terms has generated considerable public interest due to controversy around use of ‘Dham’ for West Bengal government-built temple at Digha

title: Debt trap: Six of family found dead in car in Haryana’s Panchkula, another dies on way to hospital
content: At the moment, we are investigating the case from all angles. We are questioning the people in the area and going through the CCTV footage, says DCP (Crime), Panchkula, Haryana, Amit Dahiya

title: From bear rescue centres to education of disadvantaged children, here are four volunteering opportunities around Bengaluru
content: If you find time hanging on your hands, try something new and adventurous by signing up as a volunteer. PS: It will look good on your CV as well

title: Actor Unni Mukundan booked for allegedly assaulting manager
content: Alleged assault occurred over Unni Mukundan’s manager’s positive review of a recent Malayalam film in which the lead character is played by another actor, according to FIR

title: 2026 Assembly polls will be a Gogoi versus Saikia contest, says Assam BJP chief
content: The regional Assam Jatiya Parishad hopes the Jorhat MP’s elevation as State Congress president will give the United Opposition Forum renewed momentum

title: Karnataka rains: Heavy downpour hits Hassan district, landslips on Shiradi Ghat
content: Leader of Opposition in Legislative Assembly R. Ashok will be visiting rain-hit areas of Hassan district

title: Karnataka lawyer duped by cyber fraudsters using AI-generated Donald Trump video
content: The issue came to light on May 6, when the advocate approached the Haveri Central Crime Police Station with a complaint

title: Containers from capsized Liberian ship wash ashore on Thiruvananthapuram coast in Kerala
content: Local administration deploys police personnel to ensure that nobody tampers with the containers which may contain hazardous chemicals or inflammable material

title: Top Maoist commander Tulsi Bhuinya killed in police encounter in Jharkhand
content: Nitesh Yadav, who has a bounty of ₹15 lakh, along with other Maoists also reported to have been shot; top officials of Jharkhand Jaguar including Palamu SP are camping in the area

title: Rains LIVE updates: Above-normal June rainfall to keep heat in check in most parts of India, says IMD
content: Above-normal minimum temperatures are likely over most parts of the country, except some parts of central India and the adjoining south Peninsula owing to the cloudiness

title: Nehru believed in democracy not demagoguery: Congress pays tributes to India's first PM
content: “On his death anniversary, we honour the nation’s first Prime Minister, Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru, whose vision shaped modern India. His ideals of democracy, secularism and scientific temper continue to guide our way forward,” Congress said

title: CPI leaders protest in Tirupati for revival of Visakhapatnam Steel Plant
content: CPI state secretariat member P Harinath Reddy demands the governments to allocate more funds for further development of the public-sector unit

title: Discoms told to ensure consumer satisfaction with quality power supply in A.P.
content: Grievances filed by consumers should be treated with utmost urgency and any delay, negligence and complacency of officials will be viewed as dereliction of duty, says Chief Secretary

title: Kakani Govardhan Reddy sent to 14-day judicial remand in illegal mining case
content: While the YSRCP leaders claim that it is a fake case, the TDP claims that the former minister deserves punishment

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. renames YSR district as ‘YSR Kadapa’
content: The G.O. Ms. No. 170 order has been issued in this regard by G. Jayalakshmi, Special Chief Secretary, Revenue Department

title: Study finds stingless bees increase crop yield, quality
content: A team of entomologists from Nagaland University recorded 11 major insect species foraging on chilli blooms

title: M.P. turning into ‘rape capital’: Congress asks PM Modi to get State a ‘full time’ Home Minister before May 31 visit
content: Addressing a press conference in New Delhi, Vikrant Bhuria, Adivasi Congress president, termed the incident as “Adivasi Nirbhaya case”, linking it with the infamous Nirbhaya case in 2012 in the national capital

title: India beat Uruguay 3-2 in Four Nations Junior Women's Hockey
content: Apart from Kanika (46’, 50’), Sonam (21’) was on target for India, while Milagros Seigal (3’) and Agustina Mari (24’) scored for Uruguay in the match in Rosario on Sunday (May 25, 2025)

title: Delhi CM hails V.K. Saxena on completing three years as LG
content: Rekha Gupta said that the day marked another "significant chapter in the administrative and developmental history" of the capital.

title: Congress poses questions about ceasefire conditions at Jai Hind rally in Barmer
content: The party leaders present at the event asked if Pakistan agreed to hand over Pahalgam terrorists, while Randeep Singh Surjewala slammed PM’s silence on U.S. President Donald Trump’s trade compromise remarks.

title: 10th international convention of SPIC MACAY inaugurated at IIT Hyderabad
content: The week-long exploration of India’s classical and spiritual traditions saw over 1,500 students and volunteers from across India and abroad

title: CISF sub-inspector scales Mt. Everest
content: Geeta Samota scaled the peak on May 19. She has climbed five of the world’s highest peaks and now has only North America and Antarctica left to complete the prestigious Seven Summits challenge

title: Tribal Affairs Minister highlights achievements in 11 years of NDA government
content: Complaints about alleged irregularities on clearances for the Great Nicobar project were ‘under examination’, Jual Oram said

title: Rajya Sabha election: DMK, AIADMK to begin shortlisting their candidates from Tamil Nadu soon
content: Given the strength of the two parties and their allies in the Assembly, four seats can be bagged by the DMK and the balance by the AIADMK

title: India embraces tourism, Pakistan sees 'terrorism as tourism', says Modi
content: “Terrorism is a way of making money for your (Pakistan) government and Army. The people of Pakistan must come forward to end terrorism. Live a happy and peaceful life and have your meal. Otherwise, my bullet is there for you (sukh chain ki zindagi jio, roti khao. Varna meri goli to hai hee),” the Prime Minister asserted in the direct message to those across the border

title: Students irked over Pondicherry varsity’s new code of conduct
content: The code of conduct, which seeks to enforce discipline on the campus, uses broad terms such as “decorous manner” of behaviour and provides for imposing a penalty of up to ₹6,000 for “any act of moral turpitude”

title: India pushing back ‘illegal’ immigrants to Bangladesh
content: The migrants included women and children who were detained by the Delhi Police from outer Delhi last week during a drive to identify illegal immigrants

title: Maoist leader cremated in Narayanpur amidst family’s demand to return him to his village in Andhra Pradesh
content: The police said that there had been ‘no legal claimant’ for the seven bodies, including that of top Maoist leader Basavaraju
